subtitle.Text: I think this is one where I love the way the music makes it so uplifting. Because it starts out in this very sad point where it’s sort of just like, you kind of don’t know what… I dunno, to me it was very emotionally ambiguous in a sense.
I mean she’s saying like, oh my god, I can’t believe that something’s happened, that something’s gone wrong. And as she kind of unravels the story about how she missed the first two calls,

which then takes you back to one of the first things you probably do when you get in the house was find the voice recorder. So I love how it loops it around and then it starts building this positive feeling of like, how this isn’t the end,
and we are going to see each other again, and there’s this wonderful elation that she sort of dawns on in a funny way, and that, yeah, it’s so hopeful
and it’s really nice to connect to that, and just try to express a little bit of levity after so much weight has built up over the course of her life, in this little window.
